Ask HN: Hosted web template designs for an app portfolio?
text:
In the past I've just found a basic web host and manually created some pages to display a selection apps I've worked on. I'm not that interested in doing this type of web UI work anymore and wondering if there exists more modern/easy/fast/better-looking ways of of curating a small collection of apps to put on display that looks great with minimal effort. Something like Squarespace came to mind first (maybe because I listen to too many podcast ads) but I didn't find any obvious templates there... anything similar is fair game too.

The link below is an example of what I've have done in the past, but I'm looking for a way to replicate something like this but better and less effort where I can just plug in image assets and marketing text and have it look great without me trying to come up with fancy UI/UX styling on my own anymore.

https://web.archive.org/web/20190516200912/http://blinkloop.com/

title: Cantenna (2007)
Taxonomy of Lisp [a-z]-expression forms exist?
text:
Does a central resource about the various underlying lisp expression forms exist? Aaside from typing each alphabet letter appended to "-expression' in wikipedia/search engine. aka s-expression; m-expression, q-expression, t-expression

Wikipedia alphabet approach would miss exotic expressions such as music-n [1] / nyquest [2] ; ANIMAL [3] ; iterative/generative/decorative forms such as haskel / arc [1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MUSIC-N [2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nyquist_(programming_language) [3] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANIMAL_(image_processing)

Ask HN: How do I stop bouncing around different languages when I get stuck?
text: I’ve been in a vicious cycle recently where I start learning a language (in my case a non GC one) go through some beginner books, set up my IDE for the language, start writing some small projects get stuck/bored and move on. I never get out of the beginner phase and I just end up frustrating myself. Can anyone relate? And anyone have any tips?
